timeline.bodyText: If you move this string concatenation outside, you don't have to do it on each access.
timeline.author: Maithem

replies.bodyText: VLO is protected under a lock, so you don't need to use an atomic counter.
replies.author: Maithem

replies.bodyText: Moved string concatenation to the class constructor. Replaced atomic counter by a size 1 array.
replies.author: zhangn49
xnull

timeline.bodyText:
This might produce a bimodal distribution. Since the optimistic sync is much faster (or should be) than the materialized stream sync.
Is it necessary to split them?
timeline.author: Maithem

replies.bodyText: Only measure the regular stream now.
replies.author: zhangn49

timeline.bodyText: Shouldn't this include the VLO sync latency? Why is it necessary to have another latency histogram inside the VLO ?
timeline.author: Maithem

timeline.bodyText:
why we need an array here?
It seems that we need AtomicLong, or (I prefer) just use a plain old 'for' cycle with a long variable
timeline.author: xnull

replies.bodyText:
If I use a plain for, I have to do stream.streamUpTo(syncTo).collect(Collectors.toList()).
Will it bring extra copy?
replies.author: zhangn49

replies.bodyText: yep, looks like, so please take a look at my comment about the counter, would be nice if you agree
replies.author: xnull

replies.bodyText: Yeah, I am using it right now.
replies.author: zhangn49

timeline.author: xnull

timeline.bodyText: do you need to catch the exception and log it?
timeline.author: pankti-m

replies.bodyText:
No, this try block utilizes try-with-resources
https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/api/java/lang/AutoCloseable.html
So we don't need to close this timer explicitly and it does not affect original exception workflow.
replies.author: zhangn49

timeline.author: pankti-m

timeline.bodyText: Codacy found an issue: Use explicit scoping instead of the default package private level
timeline.author: corfudb-bot
